results.title: East to north
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Explorers [Bill Peach]”.
Presented by Bill Peach, this program uses reenactments to describe the trail taken by the expeditions of Ludwig Leichardt from the eastern settlements in New South Wales north to Port Essington in Northern Australia, documenting the challenges and hardships they faced along the way.

results.title: Francisco Pizarro
results.creator_credit: Fred Burnley, Michael Latham and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Explorers”.
Depicts the events leading to the destruction of the Inca civilization by Europeans. In the wake of the civil war there was little to stop the invasion of Pizarro and his conquistadores and the Inca civilization fell because of Pizarro’s greed for power and wealth. Written by Ian Thorne and presented by David Attenborough.

results.title: Christopher Columbus
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Gordon Clark, Michael Latham and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Explorers”.
Stresses the most fascinating part of Columbus’s life - the period after he discovered the American continent in 1492. Presented by David Attenborough. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary level.

results.title: Roald Amundsen
results.creator_credit: David Cobham, Michael Latham and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Explorers”.
Dramatization of Roald Amundsen’s victory over England’s Captrain Robert Smith in their 1911 race to the South Pole, the last terrestrial frontier. Beautifully filmed with great use of re-enactments and voice-overs. Narrated by David Attenborough.

results.title: Captain James Cook
results.creator_credit: John irvin, Michael Latham and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Explorers”.
During the years 1768-1770 Captain James Cook sailed around the world in the ‘Endeavour’ and claimed Australia for the British Crown. This is an account of his voyage. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Burke and Wills
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Explorers”.
In 1860 Robert Burke and a party of explorers began the first overland crossing of Australia from Melbourne to the Gulf of Carpentaria. Both Burke and Wills perished on the way back. The film reconstructs the events that led to their deaths. This film is suitable for Years 7-12.

results.title: Henry Morton Stanley
results.creator_credit: Fred Burnley, Michael Latham and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Explorers”.
This film re-enacts the journey Stanley undertook to complete Livingstone’s exploration by searching for the headwaters of the Lualaba River in central Africa. Narrated by David Attenborough. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Enlightenment

results.title: The Marriage of Figaro
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Enlightenment”.
Consists of three scenes from Beaumarchais’ play “The Marriage of Figaro” and the same scenes from Mozart’s opera. The following scenes are performed - Act V. Part of Figaro’s monologue and part of Figaro’s aria. Act III. The duet between the Count and Susanna. Act II. Part of the scene in which Susanna is discovered in the Countess’s dressing room.(the beginning of the finale of Act II of the opera).
